intro: Ulmaria denudata, commonly known as the naked lousewort, is a small flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its flowers are small, pink to reddish in color, and appear in clusters. Ulmaria denudata is characterized by its lack of leaves on the flowering stems, giving it its common name.
